title: Negentropic Core - Physical Parameters
description: Default parameter configurations for atmospheric, hydrological, and soil solvers

h_gamma.description: Effective depth of lower-tropospheric moist inflow/condensation return flow

h_c.description: Water vapor scale height (characteristic vertical decay distance)

L.description: Inland acceptor length scale (computed from forest continuity)
L.note: Forests achieve O(10^6) m whereas non-forest declines at O(6×10^5) m

c_d.description: Bulk drag coefficient over forest canopy (depth-averaged)

f.description: Coriolis parameter (f = 2Ω sin(lat)), typical for mid-latitudes ~20°

rho.description: Air density at sea level (standard atmosphere)

LAI.description: Leaf Area Index enabling high ET and mixing (productive forest)
LAI.note: LAI > 3-4 required for sustained biotic pump

phi_f.description: Forest continuity fraction along fetch (1 = continuous, 0 = non-forested)
phi_f.note: Critical threshold ~0.6-0.7; requires contiguous widths ~200-300 km

r_T.description: Ratio of molecular weights (water vapor / dry air) = 18.016/28.966

k_E.description: ET enhancement coefficient for vapor pressure increase
k_E.note: Relates surface ET flux to atmospheric humidity increase

alpha.description: Fraction of condensation power realized as dynamic work
alpha.note: High sensitivity: enters as γ_d^-1 ~ 10^2 in pressure-gradient formulation
alpha.warning: Small changes (±0.1) produce disproportionately large wind/pressure changes

T_ref.description: Reference temperature (25°C) for typical tropical/subtropical forest

dx.description: Horizontal grid spacing (50 km for mesoscale applications)

dt.description: Timestep (1 hour for explicit momentum integration)

thresholds_and_tipping.description: Critical thresholds for regime transitions (falsifiable predictions)

minimum_canopy_density.description: Minimum forest density and continuity for sustained inland moisture import

regime_dichotomy.description: Dry vs wet regime switch in ET-precipitation coupling

dry_regime.description: Increased E raises recycling (P↑) but reduces import (C↓), lowering runoff

wet_regime.description: Increased E enhances both P and C (import), raising water yield

regime_dichotomy.note: Observable switch offers sharp, testable threshold in model behavior

precipitation_decay.description: Empirical precipitation-distance scaling distinguishing forests from non-forested interiors

forest_transects: Siberian taiga (Arctic Ocean to Central Asia)

metrics.precipitation_distance_slope: ln P(x) = a + bx, extract e-folding length 1/|b|
metrics.moisture_convergence: Verify C + E - P ≈ dW/dt from reanalysis
metrics.wind_ET_correlation: Test whether u rises with E in wet-season, high-W conditions

implementation_notes.thread_safety: Pure function, stateless (except static LUT), can parallelize
implementation_notes.mass_conservation: Continuity uhγ = wL implicit in pressure-gradient formulation
